intro: Chromolaena oteroi, commonly known as littleleaf chromolaena, is a flowering plant native to the Americas. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has opposite, narrow leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It produces small yellow flowers that are arranged in clusters, and it is known for its rapid growth and invasive tendencies in certain regions. Chromolaena oteroi is often used in traditional medicine but can be a problematic weed in agricultural areas.
